page.title: 04CONSTANTINE LIFE IN PAST
page.content: Senior citizens;change of life style. Many changes have occured in the past years since the 1945 war.There was no running water supply to houses .Water was drawn from the village supply at various points which can still be seen.A"leat" or opendrain ran down both sides of the village street draining away surplus water.No sewage system existed in 1945 and cesspits were in use.These things have now changed and we have our own mains water supply from Stithians reservoir and a sewage works at Ponjeravah.In 1945 we had a bus service to Falmouth via Port Navas and to Helston daily. Now we have only 3 buses to Falmouth per week and 2 per day to Helston. Inthe old days the village made its own entertainment where today we have radio and television in our homes. Also an Over Sixties Club.
